1.text: Behold all mine eye saw, and mine ear heard, and it will understand for it.

2.text: According to your knowledge I knew also: I fall not more than you.

3.text: But I will speak to the Almighty; I shall delight to plead before God.

4.text: And on the contrary, ye devise falsehood; physicians all of you for nothing.

5.text: Who will give silence? Ye shall be silent, and it shall be to you for wisdom.

6.text: Hear now my proof, and attend to the pleadings of my lips.

7.text: Will ye speak wickedness for God? and will ye speak deceit to him?

8.text: Will ye accept his face? will ye contend for God?

9.text: Is it good that he shall search you out? or as he mocking against a man; will ye mock against him?

10.text: Reproving, he will reprove you if in secret ye lift up faces.

11.text: Shall not his majesty make you afraid? and his terror fall upon you?

12.text: Your remembrances being likened to ashes, your backs to backs of clay.

13.text: Be silent from me and I will speak what shall pass upon me.

14.text: For what shall I lift up my flesh in my teeth, and shall I put my soul in my hand?

15.text: If he shall slay me shall I not hope? only I will prove my ways to his face.

16.text: Also he is to me for salvation for a profane one shall not come before him.

17.text: Hearing, hear ye my words, and my declaration in your ears.

18.text: Behold now I set in order judgment; I knew that I shall be justified.

19.text: Who is he will contend with me? for now shall I be silent and expire;

20.text: Only two things thou wilt not do with me: then I shall not hide from thy face.

21.text: Remove thy hand far from me, and thy terror shall not make me afraid.

22.text: And call and I will answer, and I shall speak, and turn thou to me.

23.text: How many iniquities and sins to me? make known to me my transgression and my sin.

24.text: Why wilt thou hide thy face, and reckon me for an enemy to thee?

25.text: Wilt thou terrify the scattered leaf? and wilt thou pursue the dry straw?

26.text: For thou wilt write bitter things against me; and thou wilt give me to inherit the iniquities of my youth.

27.text: And thou wilt set my feet in the stocks, and thou wilt watch all my paths; thou wilt dig round the roots of my feet.

28.text: And he as rottenness will fall away; as a garment the moth ate it.
